document_data.caption: A group of [[tabaxi]] fly over a jungle on their giant toucan mounts.
document_data.name: Toucan
document_data.mainbody: '''Toucans''' were a colorful species of tropical [[bird]] that could be found on the [[Malatran Plateau]], and possibly [[Chult]].{{Cite MTG|CLB|046|{{MTGc|Tabaxi Toucaneers||CLB}}|[[Filipe Pagliuso]]}}<ref group="note" name="Chult">Whilst toucans have yet to physically appear within any source involving Chult nor been mentioned as residing there, the toucan head statue in Papazotl's Shrine in ''Tomb of Annihilation'' and the "Tabaxi Toucaneers" card in ''[[Commander Legends: Battle for Baldur's Gate]]'' (which could possibly be a depiction of tabaxi in Chult) at least imply their presence.

Sub-Species.Giant toucans: Oversized cousins of the usually small bird species.

document_data.History: Sometime in the late 14{{th}} century [[DR]], the [[lacerial]] [[shaman]] [[Starr]] crafted a technicolored feather [[cloak]], primarily sourcing its feathers from [[parrot]]s and toucans.{{Cite organized play/LJ/Iron Will/Certificates}}
document_data.Trivia: * Within the [[Papazotl's Shrine]], one of the [[nine trickster gods]] of [[Omu]], there was one room that featured six statues of bare-chested [[human]]s with animal heads. One of these statuary heads was a depiction of a toucan's.
